glsa.title: Opera: RSA signature forgery
glsa.synopsis: Opera fails to correctly verify certain signatures.

background.p: Opera is a multi-platform web browser.

description.p: Opera makes use of OpenSSL, which fails to correctly verify PKCS #1 v1.5 RSA signatures signed by a key with exponent 3. Some CAs in Opera's list of trusted signers are using root certificates with exponent 3.

impact.p: An attacker could forge certificates which will appear valid and signed by a trusted CA.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Opera users should upgrade to the latest version:
